text: Suppose you’re trying to load data from multiple sources (e.g. , reddit, nyt, etc) into a SQLite DB. Would you store the date/time info in the sqlite db as text or as a number (i.e., as either the integer or real storage class in sqlite)?

elements.text: Suppose you’re trying to load data from multiple sources (e.g. , reddit, nyt, etc) into a SQLite DB. Would you store the date/time info in the sqlite db as text or as a number (i.e., as either the integer or real storage class in sqlite)?

text: text, so that you don't lose timezone information because of UTC normalization

elements.text: text, so that you don't lose timezone information because of UTC normalization

text: depending on timezone, the default time of `00:00` simply doesn't exist because that can be a summer time switch, where clocks are pushed forward an hour
